website_summaries.verdict: A float tube that sits high in the water, has a high weight capacity and several nice features.
pros: Mesh apron for stripping includes a fish ruler
Seat sits a little higher off the water to help keep you dry
Backpack straps let you carry inflated
cons: The backpacking straps are really not designed for taking this float long distances

customer_reviews.title: 320 lbs
customer_reviews.text: I weigh 320 pounds.' This tube is awesome. I'm barely in the water. no feeling like I was gonna tip forward like I read before. Just sit down don't plop your butt down. I did and flipped over ' I posted this for guys my size looking for the right tube . It's great
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Great Float Tube
customer_reviews.text: Great Float Tube!!! Have used it on several trips and it has worked great every time! Seat is good and high, pockets are high and can be used for storing tackle or beers!!
customer_reviews.author: Scott & Tara

customer_reviews.title: Best float tube out there!!
customer_reviews.text: This float tube is great! Keeps me out of the water and dry, made very heavy duty material, fills up very fast, lots of storage the pockets are way bigger than I thought they would be!! Just wish it would come with some kind of storage bag but other than that it’s great!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Brooks Lorenz

customer_reviews.title: Best tube I ever had! Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this tube for two seasons now and I absolutely love it! I usually spend over 8 hours in it, when I go fishing, and I don't feel any aches at the end of the day. The back of the seat is adjustable; it has a pocket that allows me to store an extra rod in it. I love the high seat and how light the tube is. The straps allows me to carry it on my back like a backpack, which is awesome if I have to travel some distance to the lake. The drink holders are a great addition and the pockets are roomy. I like everything about it.
customer_reviews.author: bilbo0316

customer_reviews.title: Love!!!! Would love another one, but they’re now in sick high demand they’re hard to find now!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to inflate/deflate, portable, holds a lot of weight. I wish I could write a bad review so everyone would stop ordering them and I could find another one! I paid $190 and now they cost $300 and over if you can find them at all. I lost one of the Boston valves, website was sold out of the official replacements, but I walked into Gander and grabbed one, so that was nice too. They do get a little mildewy if you don’t let them dry before you fold them up, and I’m afraid to spray cleaner on it because I don’t want to weaken the material, so I just deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly McDonald

customer_reviews.title: High quality and ease of use.
customer_reviews.text: I have always been an avid fisherman, and enjoy being on the water, be it by boat, kayak, etc. With no room for a kayak at my current location, and after extensive research, I decided to give this float tube try. I must say I am impressed with the quality of this float tube, and its ease of use. It takes about 5 minutes to inflate, and easy to carry with you using the backpack straps. It has plenty of room for gear and even a small ice chest. Add some tube fins, a light anchor, a PFD, whistle, and some fishing gear, and you are all set!
customer_reviews.author: J. Z.

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: I was iffy about an inflatable without a frame. I thought it would be flimsy. I was surprised by the support of this float. I'm a big guy pushing 300 lbs and I had 0 issues with feeling supported and secure. Easy to inflate and deflate. Stores in as small space. Is easy to carry inflated or deflated. I would have liked the back support to be better. And if your valves are not lined up with the hole in the fabric, the edge will put pressure on the valve and it will leak air. Have to mess with bladder alignment. I've used pontoons for years, I will be buying two more of these to replace my fleet of pontoons.
customer_reviews.author: David Doble

customer_reviews.title: Had a blast with it
customer_reviews.text: Got to use for 1st time today! It was a blast. My 1st time using float tube for fishing. Easy to set up and put away. Im 6'4 235lbs and held up perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: The_greg85

customer_reviews.title: Light weight
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fun. Nice and light, good for hiking in to remote Mt lakes. When airing up for the first time, i had to locate the valves in the tube and place them in the holes in the cover. Its best to put some air in the tube then line up with the cover and velcro in place. If u don't, the valves may move and good luck trying to remove the air in the tube when the valves are under the cover..... Seat is comfortable, back rest is good for 200lb person. When i read "pole holder" i didn't think they ment velcro straps on the side of the storage bags.
customer_reviews.author: CAN

customer_reviews.title: Nice fishable design that doesn't reliably stay inflated.
customer_reviews.text: Had fun while the thing was inflated. Good price for a good fishing design, but the achilles heel is those blasted Boston inflation valves. They leak! I leak tested the boat in the lake to ensure it wasn't a leaky flotation bladder. It is the Boston Valve. Classic Accessories has been supportive with sending me replacement valves, but one can only stand so much excitement. Be sure you can swim!
customer_reviews.author: DRM

customer_reviews.title: Nice Deluxe Version.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice large deluxe float tube. My husband had a hassle getting the fill valve to line up. He had to inflate and release multiple times. While using, I felt like I was always leaning back. I adjusted the seat strap multiple times, but that could just be me. Water does come over the seat while paddling. But again, that could just be me. I am 4 ft 10in and 185 lbs. The seat was all the way to the back of my knees. Love the pockets and storage space. Only my 2nd time ever in a float tube. I felt very secure while in the lake.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra K Oldemeyer

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this float tube! Very well made. Literally like fishing out of a lazy boy chair. And so much easier to get it down to the water, than my Hobie kayak. Lots of pocket space also. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Heckman

customer_reviews.title: Top notch
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good tube. I've float tubed for over 30 years and have fished out of original Caddis style u boats to the newer V shaped pontoon styles. These tubes are built well, VERY stable and move easily. Pockets are huge and easily accessible. Only 2 cons, seat is firm, too firm! And backrest WILL seem off as you will have it leaning forward too keep your back straight..you'll see. Overall really really impressed. BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tumbleweeds

customer_reviews.title: Great new way to fish ponds
customer_reviews.text: Best way to fly fish a pond or lake. Sit up high in water for easier casting and comfort. Easy maneuverability once you figure out how to turn. Need to be careful on a windy day not to get stuck downwind! Easy inflate and deflate. Great cargo pockets to keep fly gear and rain jacket. Many added features like rod holders, drink holders and loops to attach a net and other gadgets. This will be much easier than hauling around a car top kayak or canoe and that means that this 74 year old guy can fish many more years! Caught 18 brookies on my first voyage!
customer_reviews.author: joel arnold

customer_reviews.title: Best float tube I’ve ever used
customer_reviews.text: Best float tube I’ve ever used. 6’ / 245 lbs. and when I get in it and sit, the only part that touches the water is from my lower leg down to the fins. Everything else is above water and dry. Easy to maneuver with ample storage pockets and space for holding bait, fish, food, drink, additional rods and so forth. This is a STEAL at the price. Quality much higher than the sticker price!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great tube dont cheap out.
customer_reviews.text: for $160 this was perfect. Previously bought a cheaper version and returned. Pockets are huge and fit all my fishing stuff, very easy to inflate. Seat is very comfortable and lots of room. used my SCUBA fins and it tracked well. overall rating 5 stars... folded up the box is bigger than expected and the cup holders dont work that well when pockets are full both really a non issue considering the overall picture. good design with handles to grip and places to clip stuff on to.
customer_reviews.author: KKub

customer_reviews.title: Great tube except for backrest.
customer_reviews.text: What others have said about the seat backrest is true. I guess that if you’re a small person it works fine. But for us larger folk, it is not supportive enough, and leaning back lifts the front end up and out of the water. Even with the straps pulled tight, I could not sit up even close to straight. Otherwise I really like it. Super easy to inflate/deflate and storage capacity is great. I like the rod holders - makes it easy to take along an extra rod.
customer_reviews.author: Sue D

customer_reviews.title: Arrived today had it in the water 20 min later
customer_reviews.text: I did not get this for fishing. This is for laying in, chillin, and maybe getting pulled around our little lake behind the kayak. It is so comfortable, plenty of room. The first thing we noticed is how well it is made. We will see how it holds up I will update when we have had it a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: FairweatherNine

customer_reviews.title: Wet Short Bob
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experience with a fishing floating tube but I love it. Solid build quality and functions great. Wonderful value. Only thing i wish were a little better is that I wish the seat sat a little higher. The bottom of my shorts get a little wet when doing this but other than that it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Float Tube from Classic Accessories
customer_reviews.text: I was fortunate to find the Cumberland at a sale price. After years of using an Outcast float tube, I found the Cumberland to be roomier, more stable, and it rides higher than most float tubes because of the 5" foam seat. The cargo area behind the seat is a big bonus, as is the easy inflation with two Boston valves. Great product from Classic Accessories.
customer_reviews.author: President Charley

customer_reviews.title: Weak bladder.
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace bladders after 1 season of moderate use. Leaked on a seam. Impossible to repair. Replacements only come in pairs. After 3 outings same bladder split a seam different spot. Company warrantied it though. But still lost a few weeks of fishing. Some stitching beginning to wear on the front. Overall I'm happy with it as long as the third bladder get me through the season.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Nice float
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a lot of inflatables for both rivers and lakes. For the still water fishing we do, this is a very good U belly boat. It will hold up the weight it says it will and seems to be pretty durable and tough. You float high in comfort and feel confident in its abilities. It's easy to fish out of and holds air forever.
customer_reviews.author: guitarguy

customer_reviews.title: Durability sucks
customer_reviews.text: Bought the tube for duck hunting. Overall, it is very portable, light, and convenient to carry. After two seasons of average use, developed a leak in one of the floats. No, I didn't hit sharp rocks or stumps with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ritter

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed for pond fountain maintenance.
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to be able to get to my pond fountain out in the middle of my pond. With a set a flippers and waders maneuvering around the pond to do routine maintenance on the fountain has become a dream. So easy to set-up and most importantly being a large guy at 6'3", 290 this thing is like your favorite lay-z-boy in the water. No more getting cold, wet and dirty just to clear out a clogged nozzle on the fountain.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Masciorini

customer_reviews.title: Easy enough to use, but not to store.
customer_reviews.text: The foam seat does not collapse, which makes it great on the water, but hell in the garage. The carrying straps that come with it are pretty thin and if you have gear in the side pockets, they can dig into your shoulders. The boston valves make inflation and deflation easy. So far I've been happy with it, even those it is MIC.
customer_reviews.author: Puck

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Have never caught so many fish! Getting compliments from everyone who sees me on the lake. The seat is comfortable enough, it's easy to inflate/deflate and store/transport. Bought one for my best buddy as well.
customer_reviews.author: NCH

customer_reviews.title: Great Variation on a Float Tube
customer_reviews.text: LIKES: Comfoartable with lots of support. I fished (2) full days comfortably in this craft. , Inflates Easily, Easy to transport with removable back-pack style straps. Note: I have only fished with this craft on (1) two day trip. My review should reflect that in ANY decision to purchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great, inexpensive experience
customer_reviews.text: Took it to the lake same day I received it. Inflates and deflates fast. I'm 210 pounds, and my butt got wet anyway. With this type of vehicle, that's to be expected. I'll try it with waders next time. Great adjustable back support, which is rare among floaters. Can someone PLEASE tell me where the elusive "fishing rod holders" are located?
customer_reviews.author: Tuna

customer_reviews.title: super cool! Always wanted one as a young man
customer_reviews.text: Holy cow, super cool! Always wanted one as a young man, bought this for my 20 year old son for X-mas. I think he slept on it that night. Really, really nice. Blows up easy. Things fit together easy. Looking forward to years of fishing where most cant go.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Cole

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: A new toy for my husband. This appears to be well made and the design well thought out. It was a Father’s Day gift and it didn’t disappoint. My husband says it’s very comfortable and has great storage features for his gear. It has come in handy during this time of social distancing.
customer_reviews.author: bargain hunter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for moving & still water
customer_reviews.text: This tube was excellent in a river and also a lake. The straps came in handy for keeping the float attached to me while standing in the river to fish, stretching and removing a big fish. Also, the straps were awesome when I carried it like a backpack. Quality seems excellent so far.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M. Simon

customer_reviews.title: A Lazy Summer Afternoon
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had this much fun in a LONG time. Took this float tube ( belly boat) into our mucky shallow lake and fished for hours in the bright sun under a blue sky. The closest I have come to Nirvana in a long time. The simple setup using this float tube and flippers was just what I needed. Kinda found myself hoping no fish would bite but bite they did and I caught and released about 20 fish on my first time out. Highly recommend this well built Cumberland in a quiet pond or lake for a lazy afternoon in the sun.
customer_reviews.author: inland sailor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent float tube, you won't find better for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I've had various Caddis u-boats over the years, this thing blows them out of the water. You sit high in the water. Very easy to maneuver. My only (minor) complaint is that the bladder is velcroed into the tube where the valves come out - sometimes it's a pain to get them to line up properly when filling the boat with air. A minor inconvenience but one you want to make sure you address as the valve won't close properly and it will leak air. I'm a fat guy and this thing floats me just fine. Got one for each of my sons and they love them.
customer_reviews.author: Boneyard

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: This is my 6th float tube over many years and it's the best design thus far. You sit slightly out of the water so it's easy In-and-out. Handles well and the back rest is superb. It has a couple of useless "cup holders" that I wanted for adult beverages
customer_reviews.author: Steven Daniel

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tube! Ive purchased 3 of them 1for myself ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tube! Ive purchased 3 of them 1for myself and 1 for my wife and her girlfriend. Ive had other tubes before and what i love about this one is how high u set out if the water. The benefit of this is ease of casting& reeling, in clearer water u can see fish better and it allows u float over areas as shallow as 6 inches by just picking up ur feet &u i weigh 220 lbs. For the girls its even better. The only reason. i didnt give this tube 5starsthat is the straps 4the back rest often work loose causing u 2 readjust
customer_reviews.author: Brother Reed

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a High Sierras trip this July. First time in Gull Lake my left bladder started to loose air. Small hole from the factory killed my whole trip. Seat sits to high, so legs are kicking on top make to much noise and slashing everything. Lap net is sloppy. Overall not a good choice for a serious fly fisherman.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A Ganino Jr

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome, you can really creep around the lake and ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome, you can really creep around the lake and get into some real tight spots. A double oar works way better and has way more control than fins
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang for Buck!
customer_reviews.text: Just got a chance to use for the first time after getting a whole float tube setup for Christmas. This seemed to be the best bang for the buck float tube I found. It worked up to my expectations, easy in and out, comfortable and well set up. Looks to be well constructed and with care expect it to last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Ellison

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best thing ive ever bought for fishing.. and its perfect for the spot i goto because its about a half hour walk through the woods and you jus carry it like a backpack, its perfect.. dont even need a pump i fill it willth my lungs takes about 5 min
customer_reviews.author: Brandrenn

customer_reviews.title: It's basically half a tube.
customer_reviews.text: Bring extra clothes because you're going to get wet. Waterproof anything you bring because it doesnt float very high up. Almost impossible to maneuver or steer, you're going to have to buy a paddle or two. Poor storage placement means even with a paddle its awkward. There are defintely better alternatives and for a better value too
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Poor back support
customer_reviews.text: The backrest does not have enough support. If you lean back even a little bit it just falls backwards. I am 305 pounds. This product says it is rated up to 350 pounds. I was not able to use this product at all.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Williams

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fishing trips
customer_reviews.text: Got mine last season. Never had one before, so I cant compare it to another model. Rides high and dry. I use a padded cushion on top of the seat because its too hard. Adjustted seat back straps tight to give back surpport. Very comfortable to fish from. Plenty of storage for gear, small soft side cooler for lunch, beers, etc. Got a pair of fins, lightweight waders, and a hand pump. Only drawback is its hard to kick paddle in the wind. I use mine on the beautiful lakes and ponds in upstate New York.
customer_reviews.author: tm

customer_reviews.title: Nice tube for the price
customer_reviews.text: Really nice tube. Enjoy the large pockets and mesh in the nose so water can easily flow in and out. Only issue is the seat. Wearing shorts it rubs the backs of your legs pretty raw and it's fairly uncomfortable after a long day.
customer_reviews.author: brad

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tube and very comfortable the only issue are the ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tube and very comfortable the only issue are the bladder caps where u fill with air break easily. Both of mine broke within a week of having the tube they still work just makes it difficult to inflate. I haven't been able to find replacement caps for it either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the trouble
customer_reviews.text: Too much work, put together, put on waders, get fishing equipment-I bought a small boat
customer_reviews.author: Candace D.

customer_reviews.title: Fun on the Delaware!
customer_reviews.text: I used this tube to float down the Delaware River from the Hankins, NY to Lakawaxan, PA area. This tube glided over the small rapids you incur. I barely got wet. I know Classic Accessories doesn't recommend river floats but the Delaware is not dangerous at normal levels. The bladders held air well, the seat was high up and comfortable. The back adjusted to my comfort. We drifted four four to five hour periods. I hope this helps for info on river usage. I only made sure I went down any funnels front to back not at the side. I would believe you may tip over hitting sideways.
customer_reviews.author: Ronn

customer_reviews.title: Performs Great!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent float tube! A much needed upgrade from my older tube. Has performed as expected. Seat is very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Scott S.

customer_reviews.title: Best I have tried!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome float tube. It inflates and deflates quickly and easily with 2 accessible valves on each side. There is a ton of storage and a rod holder built in. The extra thick foam seat sits up super high which is nice when you're floating in cold water! Highly recommend this tube!
customer_reviews.author: Elletee

customer_reviews.title: Great float tube.
customer_reviews.text: The best tube for the money. Lots of storage and the raised seat is fantastic to get your butt out of the water.
customer_reviews.author: Ashton

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to maneuver.
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to maneuver. Turning around is a chore and worse if there is wind. I will have to strengthen my legs to use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Hal H. Herritt

customer_reviews.title: Helps catch fish!
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this tube, has good quality and is priced right for the most part
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Buy this tube
customer_reviews.text: Best tube ever!! Tons of storage, easy to kick around but best of all I didn't wear waders for 90% of the year the water doesn't go up past my knees. And don't forget about the cup holders, defanetly a must have.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Raus

customer_reviews.title: If You Must 'Tube'
customer_reviews.text: This is a comfortable, well designed vehicle that convinced me to stick to my canoe !
customer_reviews.author: Boitchik

customer_reviews.title: Good choice.
customer_reviews.text: As good as any I have used. Packs well when storing. Carries well when traveling to the water. Maintains inflation well on cold water.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Hager

customer_reviews.title: He wasn't sure that he would like "being out of the water" when sat in it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband's birthday and he loves it! Heavy duty but light to carry. He wasn't sure that he would like "being out of the water" when sat in it, but he likes it. Much better than the ones you have to step into he says. Lots of pockets and areas to attach other items. All of the other guys are envious of him. He's actually caught some fish using it, he says anyway. Good purchase, worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Chapmon

customer_reviews.title: Great floaty
customer_reviews.text: I use this floaty to fish my local harbors and it works like a charm. Not as much storage as my other floaty but this model holds you much higher above the water than my other model that I beleive was a yellow togiak floaty. This one will keep your boardshorts 90 percent dry for the most part.
customer_reviews.author: Griffen

customer_reviews.title: Good fishing  float.
customer_reviews.text: I used this one time. Floated down the river for five hours. Unfortunately I put it in the truck and went to get the kids float and someone stole it. Had it for two days. It was really a good fishing float. If I had the money I would purchase it again. I cant stand a thief.
customer_reviews.author: France Ray Brock

customer_reviews.title: Great for fishing. Not great for backpacking.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my wife. It's a great tube. Comfortable to sit in, kept her high out of the water, etc... However, it is not ideal for backpacking. It's bigger than your average tube and the foam in the seats is not removable. We opted to fish from the shore of the lake we hiked into vs. hauling this huge thing in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is high quality and the high seat allows for better and longer casts
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this float tube. It is high quality and the high seat allows for better and longer casts. The back packing straps are just that - black straps with no padding. If you are going to hike in a ways to fish, then I recommend investing in a padded back packing type strap.
customer_reviews.author: Rudymd

customer_reviews.title: Husband said... "would buy this again and again"  Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Husband used this within a week of purchase. He was so impressed with the ease of use, plus being seated high above the float - so he could cast as many times as he wanted. Plus he could see where he was going. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Palmilla

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for small lakes
customer_reviews.text: The Float Tube is plenty big, lots of storage in the back and in the arms for gear.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Good float
customer_reviews.text: I do not fish but used it with grand kids lot of fun
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! And massive!! Only issue i had was it didnt come with an adapter and the coleman dual action pump i got has a boston value adapter but isnt the same size. i just sanded it down a hair and it works. Cup holders are nice large pockets for tackle , straps for carrying that can also be connected and attached to you so you can wade in shallow water if you want. All in all very pleased with it, especially being that i got it for $170.
customer_reviews.author: Steve-O

customer_reviews.title: Great tube..
customer_reviews.text: Have tried a dozen tubes and there isn’t a better tube for the price... super durable. I have two...
customer_reviews.author: Matthew T.

customer_reviews.title: Great products. I have used the Togiak model for ...
customer_reviews.text: Great products. I have used the Togiak model for several years over rocks and severe service and they were up to the task. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: R. Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice tube! Holds this big guy comfortably for hours at a time. Start of second season in April, will advise on durability
customer_reviews.author: Anne Bischof

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic float tube
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic float tube! !!! Really well made. I weigh 210lbs. I have a fish finder with battery pack, rod holders,lots of tackle boxes and this tube still rides nice and high in the water and is easy to move around the lakes! The shipping was fast and the tube was securely packaged. I am very pleased with this purchase and I would recommend this float tube to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend for anyone who enjoys lake fishing
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from lake fishing with this tube in the Eastern Sierras. The tube worked out perfectly, without issues. The seat is completely adjustable for leaning or upright sitting. You sit above the water with the knees out as well. Would recommend for anyone who enjoys lake fishing.
customer_reviews.author: wpiya

customer_reviews.title: Ride moderate rapids or float and fish.  FUN
customer_reviews.text: This is great on the river. I’ve worn out one and ordered two more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best fishing tube ever
customer_reviews.text: What a great product! Well made, roomy, the seating position is great, and is comfortable. It moves easily in the water and I love the pvc covered bottom. Lots and I means lots of storage. Sitting up higher compared to my last float tube is a real plus. This tube is easy to inflate and I can be on the water in five minutes. I look forward to years of enjoyment from the Cumberland
customer_reviews.author: sid

customer_reviews.title: All the best features on one product
customer_reviews.text: Every design feature on this item works very well The seat cushion keeps most of you out of the water The mesh catch screen attached easily provides an effective work area The curved bow makes navigating in breezy conditions easier The storage compartments are large enough for gear The Velcro strips for equipment well placed and effective Backpack straps make getting this device to a destination that requires a hike very comfortable Adjustable seat back great for changing positions easily for back support
customer_reviews.author: REM

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy this float tube
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy this float tube. Floats high in the water, good back rest, plenty of room. Take some time to inflate / unpack this product prior to fishing. Once the float tube has been inflated the first time, it's easy to do it in a hurry in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Chet Voss

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love it bought it for my father to fish in lake and on Delaware river near by. Good support to rider, good amount of room for fishing tackle and such. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice unit, sets high so you stay warm & ...
customer_reviews.text: Very Nice unit, sets high so you stay warm & dry, also casting is very easy from the higher seat and the unit is very stable in the water. I would buy the Cumberland again but the way it is built I won't have to for many years. "Thank You" Cumberland for making a High Quality Product.
customer_reviews.author: outboard

customer_reviews.title: Best float tube on the market
customer_reviews.text: Best float tube on the market... some foolish people i know think that its the ones with the feline name, but theyre out of their mind. The Cumberland rides nicely out of the water, even with mee(i weigh 245lbs) and all my gear on it, plenty of space for my tackle and accesories in the area behind the seat back, d rings on the side where i attach my pvc rod holder rack, and two drink holders. Plus the apple green color is too sick. Stop looking people, and go with the Cumberland. You wont be disaapointed!
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Medina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: This is the best product for the money on the market. I couldn’t be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Scott D.

customer_reviews.title: Fish away
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Quick to inflate, and well made. Good value!
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT!!! Cannot say enough good things about it. More than as advertised. One of the bladders had a leak at the boston valve underneath the Velcro. Kristina in the warranty department had one shipped and delivered in less then a week! Outstanding service! Buy one and you will be pleased.
customer_reviews.author: alex zakalyk

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, excellent warrenty, excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.text: This tube will not disappoint! Comfortable and robust with plenty of storage for a long day of pond fishing. Furthermore, classic accessories has top notch customer service and a one year warrenty on this tube. This tube has completely changed my fishing game.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Chabaneix

customer_reviews.title: Little trouble keeping inflation valve in center of outer covering ...
customer_reviews.text: Little trouble keeping inflation valve in center of outer covering opening. Tends to twist during inflation making it hard to put on cap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid seat, high vantage point, and great storage.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is an absolute unit! Great platform for fishing and tons of space. I bought a U-shaped float tube for a second and now I wish I had just bought another one of these. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Respess

customer_reviews.title: Both bladders leaking!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one year ago. I’ve had it on the water 7-8 times. Both bladders now have a hole in them. The holes are each in the seams and not related to misuse. Very disappointed in the quality of the bladder material. Would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart V Weatherwax

customer_reviews.title: item actually is as described
customer_reviews.text: i purchased the pump and with it the float tube inflates very quickly. i use it to fish the local small lakes.
customer_reviews.author: Lin

customer_reviews.title: Outside of that I love the float tube even without being able to fill ...
customer_reviews.text: I put the float tube reply on the fly rod mount. The float tube still needs the air valve that the company said they would send me two months ago.Outside of that I love the float tube even without being able to fill one bladder all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: After using it on an area lake I am extremely happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have an inner tube based float tube and just received the Cumberland. After using it on an area lake I am extremely happy with my purchase. The pontoon floats coupled with the floating seat kept me high and dry out of the water. The adjustable seat back kept my back supported and I had no aches after fishing for about 3 hours. WBA -- Would Buy Again!
customer_reviews.author: T. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great tube!
customer_reviews.text: I received my new float tube on time and as promised and have really enjoyed using since. Taken it on a couple camping / fishing trips in the last month. It's easy to inflate. ( I use a battery operated pump) Love the storage. I only wish it had a rod holder built in ( one to hold the rod while fishing) It does come with holders to carry your poles but not while fishing. It's easy to manuvere in the water and so far I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Craig H. Kinaman

customer_reviews.title: Now overpriced
customer_reviews.text: It's the best tube I have ever owned I bought mine in July 2018 for $161 and now your asking $300 more for the same tube I was going to buy one for my wife but I guess I will research other brands
customer_reviews.author: wayne m  zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a good float tube. It fits big people well. I like it!
customer_reviews.author: Darren Mikesell

customer_reviews.title: I found this to be WAY better that expected
customer_reviews.text: I found this to be WAY better that expected. I have had other tubes this one is the best. Moves quickly thru the water, wind didn't bother it too much and maneuvered well. I could get into about 8 inches of water too. The only thing in the water were my legs below the knee and the bottom of my butt. This tube is more than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: donald

customer_reviews.title: and this boat is so much better! You actually sit out of the water
customer_reviews.text: Wow, before I bought this I had one of the original "belly boats" that is simply canvas around a tractor tire tube with a diaper seat in the middle . . . and this boat is so much better! You actually sit out of the water! Only my knees and lower get wet, and you sit higher so you can cast and see better. It's great!
customer_reviews.author: William J Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Super stable obviously not very fast. Not great in weedy waters.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I can't imagine a better float tube for the money..... I love mine.
customer_reviews.author: Just Garlic

customer_reviews.title: Bulky, Heavy Design
customer_reviews.text: This has a bulky, heavy design. I took one look at this and sent it back. Purchased a much lighter model out there that is a 1/3 of the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Am Vickers

customer_reviews.title: but arrived packaged great, unfolded just like directions said
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had it out yet, but arrived packaged great, unfolded just like directions said, seems well made, and blew up appropriately. Has loads of storage room in pockets and the back of the seat. Reaedy to go any day now!
customer_reviews.author: Reno

customer_reviews.title: Best of the Best
customer_reviews.text: This is my fifth float tube in the 40 years I have been using them. I have a good unit but it becomes uncomfortable on the bottom after about 2 hours. The reviews on this were so good I had to bite. It is as good or better than the reviews. After 3 to 4 hours there is no sore bottom. It handles well in all conditions of water. Very well made and should last several seasons. If you find a better tube, buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: This is a high quality item however I would like for the company to recommend the pump for this ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality item however I would like for the company to recommend the pump for this item in writing with the description.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley P.

customer_reviews.title: You will have a good time, as long as the factory does not cross thread your air fittings
customer_reviews.text: I really should have knocked a few stars off for a problem I first experienced with this product, but I had so much fun my first trip out so I will be nice. It was obvious that this was a factory packaged float, however, 1 of the 2 Boston air inlets came screwed on, when I first tried applying air there was a large leak, after removing the air fitting I saw the obvious, the air fitting was cross threaded on, the threads were all chewed up because of this. After correctly aligning the threads it held air fine. It is alarming that this float could have came from the factory the way!
customer_reviews.author: drjoeshmoe

customer_reviews.title: great product overall
customer_reviews.text: Great product I have had 2 zippers replaced already within the first month..already on my 2nd boat from warranty..make sure you fill out the warranty paper because they will replace
customer_reviews.author: Reeseee

customer_reviews.title: Great choice
customer_reviews.text: Love it. A little bigger footprint, but very stable and lots of room. I did a lot of research on them, and this seems the best for $.
customer_reviews.author: robert carby

customer_reviews.title: Really great tube for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely one of the better float tubes out there. I have a Caddis pro2000 that I really like but this one is a bit better.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R.

product_meta.title: Classic Accessories Cumberland Inflatable Fishing Float Tube
product_meta.description:
The Camo Gunnision Float Tube by Classic Accessories is an extra large front-entry float tube with a hydrodynamic hull shape and unique sculpted design for improved tracking and steering

AMAZON.COM


Front View Real Tree Max 4 Backrest CAMO GUNNISON
 FOR BACKCOUNTRY HUNTING AND FISHING
 *  SPECIAL FEATURES 
   
 *  Extra room, comfort and buoyancy 
 *  Extra large and comfortable backrest 
 *  Hydrodynamic hull shape for improved tracking and steering
 *  Unique sculpted design
 *  Stripping apron with fish ruler 
 *  Horizontal rod holder
 *  Roomy armrest storage with additional reel pockets, gear pockets, small mesh pockets and flat zip pockets
 *  Rear storage pocket and exterior mesh storage pocket
 *  D-rings for attaching gear and creel bags
 *  250 pound capacity
 *  1 Year Warranty

 *  SAFETY FEATURES
 *  Quick-release stripping apron
 *  Safety flag pocket
 *  Safety labeling as per ABYC standards
